required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Follow-up of Low Birth Weight Cohort of 2008-2013

brief_summary.textblock: The Randomized Control Trail included 4,172 low-birth weight children between February 2008 and September 2013 in Bissau. The children who were included in the RCT and who are living in the Bandim Health Project study area will be visited. The study assistants will ask about the health of the child and of both parents. Furthermore, Bacille Calmette-Guerin (BCG) scar status of both child and parents will be checked.

primary_outcome.measure: mortality differences between group who received early BCG and late BCG

secondary_outcome.measure: hospitalization rate between early BCG and late BCG group
consultation rate between early BCG and late BCG group
medication use between early BCG and late BCG group

other_outcome.measure: hospitalization based on parental scar status
consultations based on parental scar status
medication use based on parental scar status

arm_group.description: Children received BCG soon after their birth between 2008 and 2013.
Children received BCG when they are 2,5kg between 2008 and 2013.

study_pop.textblock: Children who participated in the low birth weight trial between 2008 and 2013.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participation during the low birth weight BCG trial between 2008 and 2013.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not living in the Bandim Health Project's study area.

reference.citation: Aaby P, Roth A, Ravn H, Napirna BM, Rodrigues A, Lisse IM, Stensballe L, Diness BR, Lausch KR, Lund N, Biering-Sørensen S, Whittle H, Benn CS. Randomized trial of BCG vaccination at birth to low-birth-weight children: beneficial nonspecific effects in the neonatal period? J Infect Dis. 2011 Jul 15;204(2):245-52. doi: 10.1093/infdis/jir240.

Biering-Sørensen S, Aaby P, Napirna BM, Roth A, Ravn H, Rodrigues A, Whittle H, Benn CS. Small randomized trial among low-birth-weight children receiving bacillus Calmette-Guérin vaccination at first health center contact. Pediatr Infect Dis J. 2012 Mar;31(3):306-8. doi: 10.1097/INF.0b013e3182458289.
